title: Multiple file downloads problem with new Firefox 84.0 upgrade
content: I noticed a strange problem on my iMac after installing the latest version of Firefox 84.0. When I attempt to download multiple image files via the "Page Info" Media tab, the download appears to initiate, but then gets stuck. It doesn't even appear in the Downloads window either, but I know it's processing invisibly in the background because when I quit Firefox I get the message "you have 1 active download. do you want to quit?" I tried this on several websites just to see if maybe one website was the issue, but it happens everywhere. However, when I download one single image at a time, that file seems to download immediately without any issue, and appears in the Downloads window. I rebooted Firefox in safe mode to see if there was an add-on or extension causing the issues, but I still have the problem. I even reset my Downloads folder using the config settings. The downloads worked fine when I was using 83.0. Anyone have idea what the problem might be?

title: Firefox autoconfig
content:
Hi,

I have created autoconfig.js and firefox.cfg files, trying to set proxy setting, no proxy

Below is autoconfig.js, placed in \program files\mozilla firefox\defaults\pref folder \\ pref(“general.config.filename”, “firefox.cfg”); pref(“general.config.obscure_value”, 0);

Below is firefox,cfg, placed in \program files\mozilla firefox folder

// Set no proxy Pref("network.proxy.type", 0);

Firefox version is 84 64 bit, installed from .msi package with SCCM I have checked that those two files extensions are correct.

Opening Firefox about:config, see upload images


-jukka-
creator: jukka.kylliainen

title: Print to PDF not working with version 84.0 (64-bit)
content:
After updating Firefox to the latest version (84.0 (64-bit)) the Print to PDF functionality is no longer printing the PDF correctly.

After looking into the issue, it seems that when printing to PDF, Firefox is ignoring the CSS data which it is using to display the UI in the browser, and thus the resultant PDF, is quite frankly, a mess...

On other browsers, this is still working OK, and no issues are encountered. Also, this is a system which has been running for the past 4 years or more, and there were no changes from our end which might have caused this problem.

This problem started presenting itself after updating Firefox to the latest version.

Please advise.

Thanks.

title: "Connection has timed out" for every website in Firefox, not other browsers
content:
Hey everyone,

since some time now, Firefox on my laptop won't load any websites. When I click on on of my bookmarks or type in a URL, it first starts loading forever and eventually gives me the "Connection has timed out" error. This happens for every website, but only in Firefox. Other browsers like Chrome or Edge do not have this problem. I re-installed Firefox and deleted all files related to it manually (in appdata and programms folders) to make sure everything is gone. After a fresh re-install, it worked for a while, but then stopped working again. I don't know what caused this. I have also tried every step explained on this website already: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-cant-load-websites-other-browsers-can

My Firefox version is 83.0 and my Windows version is Windows 10 Home, Version 10.0.18363 Build 18363.

I would greatly appreciate your help! Thanks, Tim

creator: soheil.amiri

title: Mozilla service idea
content:
Hi Mozilla, I write this message here since I can't find a good place to contact you (bugzilla.mozilla.org maybe?)

Anyway, I'm a huge fan of everything you do and how you do it, and I don't hesitate from time to time to donate to the foundation.

I'm aware that most of your products and services are free, and therefore you need more resources than only donation.

The reason why I send this message, it's because I think you could add a new (paid) service to your list. A reliable and robust MX mail server system, that we could rent each month.

I'm actually renting 2 Cloud VPS, and my biggest issue was to have a trustable mail server that would not look suspicious for spam filters (spam assassin, Google etc).

That's the only reason why I pay a Google Suite every month.. to have a reliable and solid @mydomain email, and be sure my emails will be delivered every time. But I would totally prefer to give you this money better than them.

I know there's other solutions already, but I think it make sense for Mozilla to have this service, since emails and mail servers are very sensitive regarding privacy, personal data etc. and we all trust you more than Google empire.

I don't know if you can read this, but please tell me if there's a better place to send this message.

Thank you very much, Long life to Mozilla, all the best,

Phil
creator: phlppe.boehm

title: Seeking a Keyboard Shortcut
content: I am totally blind, and quite often websites displays a question something like, "Website X would like to access your location. Allow?" My issue is that I cannot find a keyboard-only method to answer that pop-up. Most of the time, I cannot find the "click" control to say either "allow" or "don't allow." I hope that there is a way that I can respond to those pop-ups without sighted assistance because I do not have such assistance readily available, and the pop-up apparently disappears after a few seconds. The old Internet Explorer had a shortcut ALT-N to reach that bar or whatever it was so that a blind person could enter a response. Firefox needs something like that function if it doesn't already exist so that we who are blind would have access to this type of pop-up equal that of sighted users.
